|              | Interfr agmentary strain reduced to 15%                                                      |
+--------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Soft Callus  | Chon droblasts pr oliferate and lay down Type 2 cartilage                                    |
|              |                                                                                              |
| 1-4 weeks    | Forms bridging endosteal callus                                                              |
|              |                                                                                              |
|              | Strain further reduced to 2-5%                                                               |
+--------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Hard Callus  | Chon droclasts resorb cartilage                                                              |
|              |                                                                                              |
| 4-16 weeks   | Os teoblasts lay down type 1 collagen                                                        |
|              |                                                                                              |
|              | At endosteal surface replacing cartilage (en chondral)                                       |
|              |                                                                                              |
|              | At p eriosteal surface (intra-me mbranous)                                                   |
|              |                                                                                              |
|              | Collagen mi neralized to form woven bone (hard callus)                                       |
|              |                                                                                              |
|              | Fracture stable                                                                              |
|              |                                                                                              |
|              | Strain \<1%                                                                                  |
+--------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Remodeling   | Woven bone remodeled according to Wolff's aw to give stress o rientated mature lamellar bone |
|              |                                                                                              |
| Years        | Basically primary bone healing                                                               |
+--------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

## Composition of Articular Cartilage


+--------------------------+------------------+----------------+--------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Component**            |                  |  **Amount**    |                                            | **Features**                                                          |
+--------------------------+------------------+----------------+--------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Cells**                | **Chondrocytes** | 2%             |                                            | Maintain and produce Matrix                                           |
+--------------------------+------------------+----------------+--------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Extracellular Matrix** | **Water**        | 80% wet weight |                                            | Permits deformation and nutrition by movement in and out of cartilage |
+--------------------------+------------------+----------------+--------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Collagen**             | 70%              |                | Responsible for tensile strength           |                                                                       |
|                          |                  |                |                                            |                                                                       |
|                          | 90% type 2       |                | 6 – binds chondrocytes to matrix           |                                                                       |
|                          |                  |                |                                            |                                                                       |
|                          | 10% 6, 10, 11    |                | – calcified zone                           |                                                                       |
|                          |                  |                |                                            |                                                                       |
|                          |                  |                | – Acts as a binder of the lattice          |                                                                       |
+--------------------------+------------------+----------------+--------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Proteoglycans**        | 20%              |                | Responsible for tensile strength           |                                                                       |
|                          |                  |                |                                            |                                                                       |
|                          |                  |                | Negatively charged therefore attract water |                                                                       |
+--------------------------+------------------+----------------+--------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Other**                | 10%              |                | Matrix Mettaloproteinases                  |                                                                       |
|                          |                  |                |                                            |                                                                       |
| **Proteins**             |                  |                | Elastin                                    |                                                                       |
|                          |                  |                |                                            |                                                                       |
|                          |                  |                | Glycoproteins                              |                                                                       |
+--------------------------+------------------+----------------+--------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+


## Changes to Articular Cartilage with Age and Osteoarthritis


+:-------------------------------------------------------+:------------------------------------------------------+:--------------------------------------------------+
| Parameter                                              | [**Ageing**]{style="font-weight:bold; color:#000090"} | [**OA**]{style="font-weight:bold; color:#000090"} |
+--------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| [Water content]{style="font-weight:bold"}              | Decreases                                             | Increases                                         |
+--------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| [Synthetic activity]{style="font-weight:bold"}         | Decreases                                             | Increases                                         |
+--------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| [Collagen content]{style="font-weight:bold"}           | Decreases                                             | Decreases (concentration increases)               |
+--------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| [Proteoglycan content]{style="font-weight:bold"}       | Decreases                                             | Decreases                                         |
+--------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| [Chondrocyte Size]{style="font-weight:bold"}           | Increases                                             |                                                   |
+--------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| [Chondrocyte number]{style="font-weight:bold"}         | Decreases                                             |                                                   |
+--------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| [Chondroitin: Keratin ratio]{style="font-weight:bold"} | Decreases                                             | Increases                                         |
+--------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| [Stiffness (young's)]{style="font-weight:bold"}        | Increases                                             | Decreases (high water content)                    |
+--------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+


## Diagnostic Criteria For RA (American college of Rheumatologists)

|                                                        |
|:-------------------------------------------------------|
| 1\. 3 or more joints swollen for \>6 weeks             |
| 2\. Morning Stiffness for 1 hour per day for \>6 weeks |
| 3\. Hand or Wrist involvement for \>6 weeks            |
| 4\. Symmetric polyarthropathy                          |
| 5\. Rheumatoid nodules                                 |
| 6\. Rheumatoid factor positive                         |
| 7\. Radiographic features typical of RA                |

## Biologic Changes after Nerve Injury

::: callout
+---------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------+
| Region                                | Changes                                                         |
+---------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------+
| [Proximal]{style="font-weight:bold"}  | Axon atrophies but doesn't die                                  |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | Cell body changes                                               |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | Migrates to periphery of cell                                   |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | -   Starts producing regenerative proteins                      |
|                                       | -   Cell volume Increases                                       |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | Chromatolysis -- degeneration of Nissl bodies                   |
+---------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------+
| [Distal]{style="font-weight:bold"}    | Wallerian degeneration occurs                                   |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | De-myelination                                                  |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | Axon is phagocytosed                                            |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | Endoneurium collapses but intact (unless neurotmesis)           |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | Schwann cells proliferate                                       |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | Proximal axon forms growth cones -- sprouts on each fibre       |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | Schwann cells form columns (bands of bunger) - direct re-growth |
+---------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------+
| [Motor]{style="font-weight:bold"}     | \<3months                                                       |
|                                       |                                                                 |
| [End Plate]{style="font-weight:bold"} | More end plates are generated -- seek out nerve supply          |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | 3-6 months                                                      |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | Begins to degenerate                                            |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | Muscle spindles and sensory organs egenerate                    |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | 12-18 months                                                    |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | End plate dies                                                  |
|                                       |                                                                 |
|                                       | Unable to be re-innervated                                      |
+---------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------+
:::

## Pathologic Process of Osteoarthritis

::: callout 
+-------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [Stage 1]{style="font-weight:bold"} | Mechanical disruption of the collagen network                                                                 |
|                                     |                                                                                                               |
|                                     | Increased water content                                                                                       |
+-------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [Stage 2]{style="font-weight:bold"} | Alters balance of cartilage metabolism -- catabolic processes dominate                                        |
|                                     |                                                                                                               |
|                                     | Products of catabolism are released into synovial fluid                                                       |
|                                     |                                                                                                               |
|                                     | (Chondroitin & keratan sulphate, collagen & PGs fragments)                                                    |
+-------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [Stage 3]{style="font-weight:bold"} | Incites an inflammatory response                                                                              |
|                                     |                                                                                                               |
|                                     | PMNs, Macrophages, IL-1 and MMPs accumilate                                                                   |
+-------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [Stage 4]{style="font-weight:bold"} | These mediators degrade the cartilage matrix, disrupt collagen further and alter chondrocyte function         |
+-------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [Stage 5]{style="font-weight:bold"} | Histology shows Fibrillated, eburnated, sclerotic shiny cartilage with loss of chondrocytes, collagen and PGs |
+-------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
:::
